intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subruncinatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium subruncinatum is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
